instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LSOC_RST_L: What is SMC_LSOC_RST_L? SMC_LSOC_RST_L is a signal that comes out of the trackpad on Macbook Airs that can reset the SMC.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>: Keyboard Replacement Worked for a Minute, Then Fizzled Out
threads.message: Seeking help for a puzzling issue with a MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-05 logic board). After successfully replacing the keyboard it worked for a minute and get off, it functioned briefly before shutting off. Has anyone faced a similar issue? Any guidance and advice on how to approach this problem would be greatly appreciated.

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>: Keyboard Replacement Worked for a Minute, Then Fizzled Out
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Machine worked good before?
Did you test connecting known good trackpad flex/board?
Also try disconnecting the battery flex.
Just in case, test in safe mode too.

Inspect for mechanical damage; broken trace, knocked off component.

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>: Keyboard Replacement Worked for a Minute, Then Fizzled Out
threads.message: Thanks for your inputs, The machine was working perfect before, Actually I replaced only keyboard, it worked for some time but after that It stopped working. the track pad is working perfect, How to go to safe mode? the keyboard is not working, and through external keyboard I'm unable to switch to safe mode.

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>: Keyboard Replacement Worked for a Minute, Then Fizzled Out
threads.message:
I was thinking the keyboard works for 1 minute then stops, each time you power on the machine.
So actually keyboard stopped to worked completely.

Keyboard has embeded electronics.
Its information is encoded and sent to trackpad connector through <SIGNAL>KBD_I2C_SCL</SIGNAL>/SDA lines.
Be sure to get all voltages on the keyboard side of J4500.

Test if SMC reset key combination can be done.
If doesn't work, your problem is on the keyboard electronics.
<SIGNAL>SMC_LSOC_RST_L</SIGNAL> doesn't pass through trackpad.

Else, may be caused by incorrect pairing keyboard/trackpad.
Check if the keyboard is correct for your MacBook model.
Trackpad firmware doesn't accept any combination.
Shouldn't be the case, if keyboard worked few minutes; but never can be sure.
